programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: The ultimate portrait of our planet looks at the key factors that shape our natural history. In the Arctic spring, a mother polar bear and cubs have two weeks to cross the frozen sea. Time-lapse cameras capture the transformation created by floods.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: A tour of the mountain ranges reveals how animals rise to the challenge of mountain life. The snow leopard finds habitat in the largest glaciers of the world.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: Follow the descent of rivers from their mountain sources to the sea. Witness unique and dramatic moments of animal behaviour, including a piranha frenzy and a showdown between otters and crocodiles.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: Although often overlooked, caves are remarkable habitats with equally bizarre wildlife. This documentary provides a unique access to a hidden world of stalactites, stalagmites, snotites and troglodytes that brings a wealth of surprises.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: Deserts cover one fifth of the planet and they are spreading every year. We think we are familiar with the Sahara and the Kalahari but what about the Gobi or the Atacama -so many deserts have hardly been explored.

programme.title: Seven Worlds, One Planet

programme.title: Seven Worlds, One Planet

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: NFL Hall-of-Famer Earl Campbell made a career mowing down defenders. The guys take the same hellbent approach to rebuilding his 1949 Cadillac. They also customize a van for a disabled motocross rider so he can drive again.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: The team revamps an old school '34 Buick into a modern-day lowrider. After months of rebuilding the body and making a custom frame for Earl Campbell's '49 Cadillac, the Hall of Famer challenges the shop with a last-minute wrinkle.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The next challenge for the metal masters of Kindig It Design is a 1967 Chevelle with Great 8 pedigree and high expectations. Dave learns that builds don't always go according to plan, the hard way.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave has finally secured a buyer for the '48 GMC truck. He's a truck nut who wants to finish the build properly, with a color change, custom trim and new interior design. Hopefully, the guys can pick up right where they left off.

programme.title: Hot Rod Garage
programme.desc: The Drift 'Cuda is back! Project #fishtail, Tony Angelo's dream drift muscle car build, gets some suspension upgrades and sees some track time.

programme.title: Motorhead Garage TV
programme.desc: Dave Dobson checks out 3D-priinted and composite parts and shows how you can be safer when you tow your truck or drive your RV.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: This mid-engine classic needs to get back on the road. The crew goes through the engine to see if it needs a rebuild, then a fuel delivery system overhaul gets this build over some major hurdles.

programme.title: Hot Rod Garage
programme.desc: Tony Angelo and Lucky Costa try to stuff 10 pounds of engine into five pounds of car.

programme.desc: A Mustang was once a father-son project, but the project stalled and now the car hasn't run in 20 years. The guys systematically go through everything that needs to be fixed, and hopefully, they'll get this pony running again.

programme.title: Truck U

programme.desc: The team brings back the 442 Tribute car to give it a new LS engine. They also finish modifying the interior for the previously-installed TKO transmission.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Work continues on the Shop Truck Dakota. Ian works on the drivetrain components, including a complete transmission teardown and rebuild. Plus he'll show what it takes to completely rebuild the axles.

programme.title: Motorweek
programme.desc: DCA: Best of cars; DCA: Best trucks/ utilities; DCA: Best of the year winner.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A beauty of a car from Kindig's past arrives back in the shop for an engine upgrade. Dave and Kevin make a trip to Detroit to see the latest technology at Lingenfelter engine builders, and check out the Woodward Dream Cruise.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and the crew start on a 1966 Corvette, but one major challenge lies ahead for Dave the designer -- he is up against a client who is adamant that he doesn't want the color of the car to be anywhere close to the original green that it came in.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The client is finally on board with the shade of green Dave has come up with, and the car moves into the paint booth. Up till now, the client has only seen it on a swatch, so it's still a question if he'll fall for it when he sees it in person.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A returning client is back with another classic, a 1965 Mustang Fastback. He likes to keep a stock look, but with updated drivetrain, instrumentation and as many modern amenities as possible. Plus, the assembly team gets a crash course in engine turning.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: An active-duty serviceman has worked with his father for years to get their 1951 Ford pickup built, and they're ready to get it finished once and for all.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides

programme.title: Bigfoot Is Real

programme.title: Bigfoot Is Real
programme.desc: The GCBRO responds to possible sightings of a dead Bigfoot and terrifying devil-monkeys. Controversy erupts over whether to kill or not at a Bigfoot gathering, and the crew have an exciting chase through the forest at night.

programme.title: Bigfoot Is Real

programme.title: UFOs: Uncovering the Truth
programme.desc: Investigators reveal the secret history between US Presidents and the UFO phenomenon, from FDR's knowledge about a UFO battle over Los Angeles to JFK's alleged plan to share extraterrestrial secrets with the Russians.

programme.title: UFOs: Uncovering the Truth
programme.desc: Using archival audio recordings, official transcripts and incident reports, UFO researchers investigate what really happened during incredible, and sometimes life-threatening, encounters between law enforcement and UFOs.

programme.title: UFOs: Uncovering the Truth
programme.desc: UFO sightings have been caught on film across America, yet the government continues to deny the existence of extraterrestrials. Recent news of the Pentagon's secret UFO program may reveal shocking evidence of what the military has known for decades.

programme.title: UFOs: Uncovering the Truth
programme.desc: Only recently have researchers begun to understand and investigate the phenomenon of alien abduction. While today such claims are dismissed as hoax or delusion, there are time-tested, landmark cases that mainstream scholars struggle to refute.

programme.title: UFOs: Uncovering the Truth
programme.desc: Through amazing first-hand accounts from pilots and astronauts, we'll learn that sightings of mysterious, unknown objects in our skies are far more common than we're lead to believe.

programme.title: UFOs: Uncovering the Truth
programme.desc: Many researchers believe we have been visited by otherworldly spacecraft since the dawn of man. Trace the evidence from the history of ancient Egypt, to the myths of Native Americans, and through the art of the Renaissance period.

programme.title: UFOs: Uncovering the Truth
programme.desc: After decades of UFO research focusing on the skies, Unidentified Submergible Objects may be the next frontier of study. Newly declassified documents and first-hand accounts are leading researchers to believe that UFOs may be closer than we ever thought.

programme.title: UFOs: Uncovering the Truth
programme.desc: There's new evidence pointing to the possibility that ancient man was visited by extraterrestrials, influencing ancient technologies, architecture and art. One scholar reveals evidence supporting his theory that ancient Sumerians were created by aliens.

programme.title: UFOs: Uncovering the Truth
programme.desc: Deathbed confessions have provided a wealth of new evidence to UFO researchers from top intelligence, government and scientific witnesses who were sworn to secrecy in life, but couldn't leave this earth without revealing the truth.

programme.title: UFOs: Uncovering the Truth
programme.desc: There are mysterious reports coming out of Area 52, including vanishing aircraft, UFOs, and revere engineering of highly advanced technology that have convinced investigators that the military knows more about alien visitation than they will say.

programme.title: The Alaska Triangle
programme.desc: In 1918 the SS Princess Sophia was mysteriously drawn off course and smashed into a reef before sinking and killing all aboard near Juneau, Alaska. Experts seek answers to the cause of shipwreck as a ghost hunter attempts to contact her victims.

programme.title: The Alaska Triangle
programme.desc: A cryptozoologist investigates reports of a sea monster lurking beneath the icy waters of Alaska. He reviews startling eyewitness accounts and examines never-before-seen video evidence of the terrifying creature.

programme.title: The Alaska Triangle
programme.desc: Experts investigate whether an interdimensional portal led to the disappearance of an airplane in 1950. Plus, an investigation into an ape-like beast that may be responsible for a string of disappearances and mutilations in the Alaskan wilderness.

programme.title: Aliens In Alaska
programme.desc: A fleet of glimmering orbs stalk the skies above Anchorage. Strange men in black suits knock on the door of a UFO witness after an eerie light show in North Pole, Alaska. A woman is terrorized by a pack of small humanoid creatures that only she can see.

programme.title: UFOs: Uncovering the Truth
programme.desc: Technology has transformed the way we live with artificial intelligence, high-energy laser, antigravity technology and alien-looking aircraft. We discuss if these advances are due to human effort or contact with UFOs.

programme.title: Impractical Jokers: Inside Jokes

programme.desc: Roland works the tidal river eddies with jigs for snook and later he works the Gulf points for reds with top water.

programme.title: Facts of Fishing
programme.desc: Every year brown trout rush up Great Lakes tributaries to spawn.

programme.title: Fishing University
programme.desc: Sport professionals lead the way, Dean Rojas, MLF and SPRO pro and Kelly Keith, FLW and SPRO pro.

programme.title: Hank Parker's Outdoor Magazine
programme.desc: Hunting for smallmouth bass in the Thousand Islands.

programme.title: Lindner's Fishing Edge
programme.desc: Al and James use of their all-time favourite topwater baits, the frog, to target big summer bass.

programme.title: Lake Commandos
programme.desc: Steve and Berkley pro John see which produced the most walleyes, the live bait or soft plastics.

programme.title: Hook n' Look
programme.desc: Outdoor Channel V.P. of Programming, Mitch Petrie accompanies Kim on Lake Minnetonka to reveal how the bass are relating to the lake's boat docks.

programme.title: The Scott Martin Challenge
programme.desc: The Martin Family is peacock bass fishing.

programme.title: Force on Force
programme.desc: Seasons six and seven of the show are recapped.

programme.title: Bass Pro Shop's Collegiate Bass Series
programme.desc: Coverage of Day One of the 2020 Bass Pro Shops Big Bass Bash.

programme.title: Ultimate Match Fishing
programme.desc: Stetson Blaylock returns to defend his back-to-back Pelican’s Ultimate Match Fishing title against newcomer Keith Combs.

programme.title: Major League Fishing Cups
programme.desc: Nine anglers race to a target weight on Lake Waco in the Academy Sports and Outdoors Heritage Cup, presented by Magallen Outdoors, from Waco, Texas. Only six will move onto the Championship Round.

programme.title: Major League Fishing: All Angles
programme.desc: Learn how the pros played the game on Day 3 of the 2021 Heritage Cup. Featuring exclusive interviews and behind the scenes content. From Waco, Texas.

programme.title: Catching Bass With Dustin Wilks
programme.desc: Dustin fishes two different lakes in similar conditions on separate days.
